column2: SOUTH CAROLINA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column6: SC

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. A broken white line:
column4: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column6: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column8: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.

column2: 2. When approaching a railroad crossing that has a standard railroad (RR) crossbuck but no gates or flashing lights, you should:
column4: approach all crossings with extreme caution.
column6: check both directions and cross only when you know that no train is coming from either direction.

column2: 3. When your wheels run off the pavement, you should:
column4: Grip the steering wheel firmly, begin to slow down, then move slowly back onto the road surface.
column6: Hit the breaks hard.
column8: Hit the brakes firmly and attempt to cut back sharply onto the pavemen.

column2: 4. You can make a _____ turn at a ______ traffic light, unless a sign prohibits the turn.
column6: left; red

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column6: One-way traffic

column2: 6. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column6: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.

column2: 7. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 8. Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a BAC of:
column6: 0.15% or more.

column2: 9. Alcohol:
column4: makes drivers more prone to take chances.
column6: increases reaction time.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column6: Pedestrian crossing ahead

column2: 11. The octagonal shape is used:
column6: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column8: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.

column2: 12. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column6: Police officer

column2: 13. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column6: must not yield to

column2: 14. Which statement about stopping at railroad crossings is true?
column4: Never attempt to pass a vehicle when approaching a railroad crossing.
column6: Drivers can go around lowered railroad gates at a crossing where no train is in sight.
column8: The yield sign is never found at railroad crossings.

column2: 15. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column6: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 16. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column6: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column8: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.

column2: 17. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column8: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.

column2: 18. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column6: having them checked by a mechanic.
column8: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

column2: 19. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 20. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.
column6: obey signals from crossing guards.

column2: 21. At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, drivers should always:
column4: slowly pass vehicles the vehicles ahead.
column6: look to the sides of their vehicle to see what is coming.
column8: stop, listen for oncoming traffic, and proceed with caution.

column2: 22. Which shape is a warning sign?
column6: Diamond

column2: 23. You come to a railroad crossing where the crossing gates are down and the lights are flashing. What should you do?
column4: Come to a complete stop well behind the gates, wait for the tracks to clear and for the gates to raise, then proceed.
column6: Slow down, and drive around the gates if clear.
column8: Drive through the crossing gates, if you don't see a train.

column2: 24. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 25. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column6: Slow down.

column2: 26. A driver arriving at a four-way stop must yield the right-of-way to the drivers who arrived before him.
column6: True

column2: 27. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the left.

column2: 28. This sign means:
column6: You must make a U-turn.

column2: 29. Driving more slowly than the surrounding traffic:
column6: can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.
column8: is the best option in bad weather.

column2: 30. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column6: take precedence over
